meaningMnemonic: Looking up to the <radical>cliff</radical>, you see the <radical>tree</radical>s, and the <radical>sun</radical> shining down on them. Using the sun and the trees (up there on the cliff), you've devised a method to tell what time of the year it is, based on where the shadow from the trees fall. After a while, you develop a bigger system. This system is a whole <kanji>calendar</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: Remember the word 歴史, which means "history"? Using a <kanji>calendar</kanji>, you too can remember history (otherwise, who knows when these things happened). So, the reading for this kanji is the same as the reading for 歴史's beginning, because they're related.
